title: Re-arranging rune pages glitched, need help ASAP can't use pages
body:
I found out the other night how to re-order/arrange my rune pages inside the client; by click dragging them around I can re-order them how I want.

However, after I've done this, a number of pages seem to be "linked" together and there are a wide range of bugs.

Bug 1: Re-ordering pages causes 2 to 3 pages to be "linked"; when selecting the bugged page, it automatically jumps to one specific page

Bug 2: Attempting to delete/save/move the bugged pages doesn't help anything, and sometimes causes the runes to not be able to be edited/added/removed.

Bug 3: The bugged rune pages are not selectable in champion select and are all named the same (sometimes up to 3 individual rune pages are linked to one runepage/name.

Need help ASAP cause I can't play some champs due to having specific runepages that are bugged for those champs.

replies.body:
What happens if you swap back to the legacy client?  

-  On the login screen of the open beta updated client, look for the "Launch Legacy Client" text at the bottom.
-  Or create a shortcut directly to the legacy client in your League Installation. Just look for "lol.launcher" 

Make sure to submit a report through the bug icon in the updated client so our test devs can investigate this further.  If the issue persists, reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  We'll see if there is anything we can do on our side, or if a [reinstall ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) would be necessary.  Hang tight until then!

Everything works normally in the legacy client.

With some further testing I've been able to reduce the problem to Slot #4 and Slot #19/20 of the pages which are causing issues (I think).

If I move around pages, any page in these slots will cause other pages to "link" and duplicate the names of pages in those slots when in champ select.

It was worse before and I did some combination of something which caused it to have _less_ pages be duplicated... but I don't know exactly what I did.

It's something to do with moving them around and then saving/not saving when the pop-up appears asking if you "want to save your changes to the rune page".

In the legacy client when I view my pages, most of them are in the order which I set in the new client, with the exception of a few that are in a different order (the ones that are glitching).

It's almost like moving some pages around doesn't actually "save" their location, and then the client tries to reference them from their original placement but a different page exists in that place after moving.

Update: some combination of re-arranging + saving / not saving changes has now caused the problem slot to move down to #5 (out of 20 -- I have all 20 pages available).

Everything **above slot 5 is duplicated with the page name from slot 5**, except for the first slot/page.

Just wanting to throw this out there, what will the response be once the legacy client is removed completely and the issue happens again? There should be an alternative fix to this (and other problems in the new client) that should not require going back to the legacy client. Be it reinstall or delete some config files. As a person in tech support myself the option of reverting to a soon to be discontinued product/version should be a last resort on the troubleshooting list not the first thing I see every time.

The updated client is still in testing, and asking the OP to try the legacy is to help determine if the specific issue is with the client or something else- not fix it.  Just trying to gather info here on a strange problem.  

This specific issue will likely have to be resolved through a ticket if possible, or through an update by our client devs.  I do hear what you're saying though and agree that it wouldn't be in the interest of players to offer resolution that requires going back to the legacy.  Be sure to share your feedback or bugs directly to the devs as well through the [client discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion) boards.
